intro: Matelea cremersii, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant produces showy, pale yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
